conclusion: To determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), analyze the slopes of their velocity-time curves.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, represented by the slope of the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows two curves, one for Object A (red) and one for Object B (black). The x-axis represents time (\( t \)), and the y-axis represents velocity (\( v \)).
Find the point \( t_1 \) on the x-axis.
At time \( t_1 \), the velocity of Object A is decreasing, and the slope of the curve is negative.
At time \( t_1 \), the velocity of Object B is also decreasing, and the slope of the curve is negative.
To have the same acceleration, the slopes of both curves at \( t_1 \) must be equal.
Visually inspect the steepness of the slopes at \( t_1 \): The slope of Object A's curve appears to be less steep compared to Object B's curve.
Since the slopes of the velocity-time curves for Object A and Object B at \( t_1 \) are not the same, the accelerations of the two objects at \( t_1 \) are different.
No, the two objects do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
